title: Toronto Raptors president countersuing over shove seen in video
description: Newly released body cam footage is being used against Alameda County Sheriff's Deputy Alan Strickland in a civil case by Toronto Raptors' president, Masai Ujiri. Strickland first sued Ujiri in February.

title: Russian opposition leader seen 'groaning loudly' on plane after alleged poisoning
Uber and Lyft prepare to shut down in California over new law
description: Uber and Lyft could be hours away from shutting down rideshare services in their home state of California amid a heated legal battle over a new law impacting how much of the on-demand economy classifies its workers.

title: The world's largest painting is being made in a Dubai hotel ballroom by this artist
description: A British artist has taken over the ballroom of a luxury hotel in Dubai to produce the largest painting ever created on canvas.

title: These variables affect whether you live, die or get help during the pandemic
description: As the US continues to grapple with the dual crises of coronavirus and racism, two things have become clear: People of color are being hit hardest by the virus, and systemic inequities are largely to blame.

title: Judge rules against Trump in tax records subpoena fight
description: A federal judge on Thursday sided with New York state prosecutors who are attempting to get access to President Donald Trump's accounting records for a grand jury investigation.

title: Federal prosecutors charged President Trump's former adviser with defrauding donors in a border wall fundraising campaign
description: • LIVE UPDATES: Bannon is among four people arrested

title: A controversy in Australia signals the next Covid-19 nightmare
Ex-Trump adviser Steve Bannon and three others charged with fraud
Barack Obama issues a stunning rebuke of Trump
Alibaba sales soar but US crackdown may be looming
description: China's economy has bounced back from the Covid-19 outbreak in China's Wuhan province. That's great news for Alibaba, the e-commerce and cloud giant. But the company also acknowledged the threat of being caught up in the burgeoning trade war between the United States and China.

title: This is one of the most dangerous things Donald Trump has done as president
description: On Wednesday, President Donald Trump did something incredibly dangerous.

title: Hear Dr. Gupta's pointed message to Georgia's Governor
description: CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta responds to Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp's latest comments regarding coronavirus information being released, in which Kemp called the leaked report "pandemic politics."

title: WHO: 26,000 daily new cases in Europe since restrictions eased
Germans could legally have to let their dogs out twice a day
description: Dog owners in Germany could be legally required to let their pets out at least twice a day for a total of one hour under the terms of proposed new regulations.

title: CNN team was tracked by Russian operatives, investigation shows
description: A new investigation has found evidence that CNN journalists in the Central African Republic (CAR) last year were subject to constant surveillance by a team of Russian operatives.

title: Gold diggers unearth historic nuggets
description: Gold diggers in southern Australia have found two huge nuggets worth $350,000 AUD ($250,000 USD) in historic goldfields.

title: The growing list of Trump associates with legal entanglements
description: The orbit of former advisers and associates of President Donald Trump who have been indicted or found guilty grew Thursday when Steve Bannon, his former senior adviser and chief strategist, was arrested and indicted.

title: In the middle of a pandemic, Trump is in overdrive planning his own convention
Brother of Ariana Grande concert bomber given 55 years in prison
description: Hashem Abedi, the brother of the Manchester Arena bomber Salman Abedi, was sentenced Thursday to at least 55 years in prison for his involvement in the Ariana Grande concert attack that killed 22 people in May 2017.

title: Scientists say they've figured the odds of catching Covid on a plane
description: Sitting squeezed between a number of strangers on board an aircraft might feel like a risky position during these uncertain times.

title: Bannon is among four charged with defrauding donors to border wall campaign
description: Federal prosecutors charged Steve Bannon, President Donald Trump's former campaign adviser, and three others with defrauding donors of hundreds of thousands of dollars in a border wall fundraising campaign. Bannon has been arrested, according to a spokesman for the US attorney's office. Bannon's lawyer did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

title: Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny was 'groaning loudly' on flight after alleged poisoning
How a 500-year-old Chinese 'bagel' helped win a war
description: This round bread might look like a bagel. It's even got the trademark hole in the middle. But this is not a bagel. It's guang-bing, and it's got a heroic past. This is the story of how a humble little doughy treat helped China win a war 500 years ago. And that hole? There's a story there, too.

title: How this all-Muslim girls basketball team is crushing it on the court
description: Hear that swish? That's the Salam Stars crushing it on the court. The all-female varsity basketball team is made up of Muslim students from the Salam School, an Islamic school in Milwaukee. All the players wear hijabs and modest athletic wear. In an ideal world, that wouldn't be a big deal, but they often face judgment based on their outfits and their religion. But these athletes ignore the haters. The Salam Stars are focused on the game. They play to win while making space for other girls to do the same.

title: Sweden records highest death tally in 150 years in first half of 2020
description: Sweden recorded its highest death tally in 150 years for the first half of 2020, according to the country's official statistics office.

title: Kushner's secret push to sell F-35 jets to UAE causes confusion and frustration
description: A secret push by President Donald Trump's senior adviser Jared Kushner to sell advanced arms -- including F-35 stealth fighter jets -- to the United Arab Emirates has caused confusion and frustration among agencies and congressional committees that would normally be involved in such a sale but have been left in the dark.

title: Airbnb says parties are now banned
description: Addressing an ongoing problem with unauthorized parties at Airbnb listings that has been aggravated by the pandemic and public health risks, the rental behemoth issued a ban Thursday on parties at properties worldwide.

title: Jim Belushi believes this would have saved his brother John
description: Actor Jim Belushi is so pro-cannabis that he's now in the industry and says he believes his brother John would still be alive if he had been a "pot head."

title: The BlackBerry is coming back
description: BlackBerry has been left for dead countless times over the past decade, but it refuses to go away. Two years after the last (we thought) BlackBerry phone, the BlackBerry logo will appear once again on a smartphone, complete with its famous, honest-to-goodness, physical QWERTY keyboard.

title: Many leaders used Covid as cover to dent democracy. Trump may be the first to openly admit it
description: In the months since Covid-19 swept the globe, leaders the world over have been accused of exploiting the pandemic for political gain while laying waste to democratic norms. Few, if any, have gone as far as to reveal those plans publicly.

title: Boeing wins first order this year for 737 Max planes
description: Boeing has secured its first order for the troubled 737 Max in nine months.

title: Volkswagen now has another electric SUV to take on Tesla
description: Production has started in Germany on the first electric SUV from the Volkswagen brand, marking the latest push by the world's largest carmaker into cleaner vehicles.

title: Barack Obama issues a stunning rebuke of Trump
description:
• Watch: Obama's full speech to convention
• Opinion: Biden can use speech to fire Trump
• Analysis: The shoutouts by Kamala Harris that mean more than you realize

title: Judged for what he wore: A first-time author writes about class and clothing
description: At student club nights in my first few weeks of university, more than once I was asked whether I had any drugs to sell. It's true that Oxford was -- and remains -- very White, but race didn't fully explain it. There were plenty of other young South Asian men. What made them so different to 18-year-old me? It slowly became clear that it was blazers, chinos, boat shoes and, yes, Oxford shirts.

title: Mittens the cat is in the running for New Zealander of the Year
description: Mittens the cat, a famous feline from Wellington, is in the running to be voted New Zealander of the Year, going up against Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern and Director-General of Health Dr. Ashley Bloomfield.

title: World's second 'Making of Harry Potter' attraction to open
description: Great news for Japan-based muggles in need of a bit more magic in their lives --  a new 30,000-square-meter Harry Potter attraction is coming to Tokyo.

title: Broadcaster leaves MLB game broadcast after uttering anti-gay slur on air
description: A broadcaster who was heard uttering a homophobic slur on an MLB game broadcast left the booth during the contest Wednesday.

title: Recap night three of the Democratic Convention in under 2 minutes
description: President Barack Obama made a passionate appeal, singer Billie Eilish got political, and Hillary Clinton warned voters about the mistakes of 2016.

title: The 13-year-old aiming to become Ferrari's first female Formula 1 driver
description: "My favorite part of racing is the speed."

title: This app can tell you if you're drinking fake alcohol
description: How do you know whether the product you are buying is the real deal and not an inferior or harmful knockoff?

title: Mouth breathing might be ruining your sleep. Here's how to fix it
description: Living with a plugged nose isn't fun, but James Nestor was ready. Plus, it was for science.

title: Dramatic new bodycam footage shows Sheriff's Deputy shoved Raptors' president during altercation
description: Dramatic new footage has emerged of the altercation between Toronto Raptors' president, Masai Ujiri, and a San Francisco Bay Area police officer, following the Canadian team's decisive game 6 victory in the NBA Finals last year.

title: A controversy in Australia signals the next Covid nightmare
How one hotel helped unleash Australia's new outbreak
description: More than 90% of new Covid-19 cases in Australia's state of Victoria can be traced back to one quarantine hotel, officials say. The state has launched a judicial inquiry into what went wrong in the quarantine hotels that helped unleash a fresh outbreak in the state. CNN's Will Ripley reports.

title: Top ex-Obama strategist: Let me just be really clear ...
description: David Axelrod, who advised former President Barack Obama, assesses the speech the former president delivered tonight at the Democratic National Convention.

title: While Obama gave his DNC speech, Trump sent hate tweets
description: CNN's Chris Cuomo and Jeremy Diamond fact check President Trump's tweets that were posted as former President Barack Obama gave his speech at the 2020 Democratic National Convention.
